main

Class PlayerList

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.PlayerList

  • public class PlayerList
extends java.lang.Object
    Tracks methods for adding, removing, and accessing Player objects. Acts as the Subject controlling Observer updates.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int numPlayers
      Track the number of players
      private java.lang.String[] PLAYER_COLORS
      Set up the default player colors, in Red, Green, Blue, Yellow
      private java.util.ArrayList<Player> playerList
      Track the Players in player
      private Location[] startingLocations
      Create a Location list for the starting Locations

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PlayerList()
      Create a new, empty PlayerList, and set up the starting locations based on the set boardsize and stepsize.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addPlayer(java.lang.String playerName, Command playerCommands)
      Create and add a new Player, automatically setting the color and location.
      void addPlayers(java.lang.String[] playerNames, Command[] playerCommands)
      Create and add multiple players, automatically setting color and location.
      int getNumPlayers()
      Get the number of players.
      Player getPlayer(int index)
      Get a player object
      java.lang.String[] getPlayerColors()
      Get the colors that will be assigned.
      java.util.ArrayList<Player> getPlayerList()
      Get the Player list
      void removePlayer(int index)
      Delete a player from the player list.
      void resetAllPlayers()
      Go through and reset all Player objects, removing Lines and setting the Turtle locations back to the starting Location.
      void updatePlayers()
      Update all the Player objects, taking a step and updating Turtle and Lines controlled by the player

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • getNumPlayers

        public int getNumPlayers()
        Get the number of players.
        Returns:
        number of players

      • addPlayer

        public void addPlayer(java.lang.String playerName,
                      Command playerCommands)
        Create and add a new Player, automatically setting the color and location.
        Parameters:
        playerName - The name of the player
        playerCommands - The Command object containing the entered commands for a player.

      • updatePlayers

        public void updatePlayers()
        Update all the Player objects, taking a step and updating Turtle and Lines controlled by the player

      • addPlayers

        public void addPlayers(java.lang.String[] playerNames,
                       Command[] playerCommands)
        Create and add multiple players, automatically setting color and location.
        Parameters:
        playerNames - List of player names
        playerCommands - List of Command objects representing player commands

      • getPlayer

        public Player getPlayer(int index)
        Get a player object
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the player
        Returns:

      • removePlayer

        public void removePlayer(int index)
        Delete a player from the player list.
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the Player to remove

      • getPlayerList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Player> getPlayerList()
        Get the Player list
        Returns:
        ArrayList of Players controlled by Playerlist

      • resetAllPlayers

        public void resetAllPlayers()
        Go through and reset all Player objects, removing Lines and setting the Turtle locations back to the starting Location.

      • getPlayerColors

        public java.lang.String[] getPlayerColors()
        Get the colors that will be assigned.
        Returns:
        String List, with colors as hex strings (e.g. 0xFFFFFF)
